alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued September 20 at 8:26PM MDT until September 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 6000 Feet. Total snow accumulations up to 3 inches; however, the highest peaks may see isolated amounts of 6 inches or more, particularly over the Southern Rocky Mountain Front. Winds may gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region and Southern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to 6 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Backcountry travel and activities will be most impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The most intense snow bands may drive snow levels down to 6000 feet or even lower, especially Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Outdoor recreationists should be prepared for early winter conditions. Snowfall could impact roads and the cold wet weather may result in hypothermia for those not properly dressed.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
